newsitem.title: USA: Latin American banking growing - survey.
newsitem.headline: Latin American banking growing - survey.

text.p: Latin America's banking sector enjoyed strong asset growth in 1996, according to survey results released Wednesday by Latin Trade magazine.
The magazine said its annual survey, published in its July issue, showed that the region's top 50 banks had combined assets of $620.8 billion last year, up 12.1 percent over 1995.

The magazine said Brazilian banks continue to dominate the sector, with the three largest banks are Brazilian, measured by assets, and six of the 10 largest banks in Latin America are in Brazil. Three Mexican banks were rated fourth, fifth and eight in size, and an Argentinian bank was in ninth place.
The magazine said Brazil's Caixa Economica Federal strengthened its position as Latin America's largest bank by increasing its assets 7.3 percent to $90.8 billion last year.
It said the highest growth was registered by the Mexican branch of Spain's Banco Bilbao Vizcaya , which grew 72.3 percent.
Latin Trade is a monthly magazine published by California-based Freedom Communications in both English and Spanish.
